Name: REQ-3.5.2
Notes: General
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.2.1
Notes: Each communication session managed by an entity shall allow the exchange of data with only one other entity.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.2.3
Notes: The information Initiation of a Communication Session and Version not Compatible (see sections 3.5.3 and 3.17) shall be the same in every system version.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3
Notes: Establishing a communication session
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.1
Notes: It shall be possible for ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment and RBC to initiate a communication session.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.2
Notes: A Radio Infill Unit (see section 3.9.3) shall never initiate a communication session.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.3
Notes: Note: Only communication sessions between an ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment and a trackside equipment (RBC or Radio Infill Unit) are considered here.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.4
Notes: The on-board shall establish a communication session
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.4.a
Notes: At Start of Mission (only if level 2 or 3).
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.4.b
Notes: If ordered from trackside.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.4.c
Notes: If a mode change, not considered as an End of Mission, has to be reported to the RBC (only if level 2 or 3)
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.4.d
Notes: If the driver has manually changed the level to 2 or 3
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.4.e
Notes: When the train front reaches the end of an announced radio hole
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.4.f
Notes: When the previous communication session is considered as terminated due to loss of safe radio connection (refer to 3.5.4.2.1)
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.4.g
Notes: When a Start of Mission procedure, during which no communication session could be established, is completed in level 2 or 3
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.4.1
Notes: In respect of a), b), c), d) and e) of 3.5.3.4, the on-board shall not establish a new communication session with an RBC/RIU in case a communication session is currently being established or is already established with this RBC/RIU.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5
Notes: The order to contact an RBC shall include
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.a
Notes: The identity of the RBC.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.b
Notes: The telephone number of the RBC.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.c
Notes: The action to be performed (establish/terminate the session).
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.d
Notes: Whether this applies also to Sleeping units.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.1
Notes: See table at the end of section 3.5.3.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.2
Notes: If the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment has to establish a communication session with an RBC whilst in session with another RBC, the existing communication session shall be terminated (see 3.5.5.2 for details) and the new one shall be established. Exception: the order to contact an Accepting RBC shall not terminate the communication session with the Handing Over RBC.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.3
Notes: The order to contact an Accepting RBC shall be part of the RBC transition order and shall include:
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.3.a
Notes: The identity of the Accepting RBC.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.3.b
Notes: The telephone number of the Accepting RBC.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.5.3.c
Notes: Whether this applies also to Sleeping unit.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.6
Notes: The order to contact a Radio Infill Unit shall include
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.6.a
Notes: The identity of the Radio Infill Unit
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.6.b
Notes: The telephone number of the Radio Infill Unit
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.6.c
Notes: The action to be performed (establish/terminate the session).
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.7
Notes: If the establishment of a communication session is initiated by the on-board, it shall be performed according to the following steps:
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.7.a
Notes: The on-board shall request the set-up of a safe radio connection with the trackside. If this request is part of an on-going Start of Mission procedure, it shall be repeated until successful or a defined number of times (see Appendix A3.1). If this request is not part of an on-going Start of Mission procedure, it shall be repeated until at least one of the following conditions is met: End of Mission is performed Order to terminate communication session is received from trackside The train passes a level transition border (from level 2/3 to level 0, NTC, 1) with its front end. Order to establish communication session with a different RBC is received from trackside and the order does not request to contact an Accepting RBC.   The train front passes the start of an announced radio hole   Regards RIUs only: Level 1 is left A request shall be repeated immediately after EURORADIO has indicated that setting up the safe radio connection has failed.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.7.b
Notes: As soon as the safe radio connection is set-up, the on-board shall send the message Initiation of communication session to the trackside.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.7.c
Notes: As soon as the trackside receives the information, it shall send the system version.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.8
Notes: When the on-board receives the system version it shall consider the communication session established and:
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.8.a
Notes: If one of its supported system versions is compatible with the one sent by trackside, it shall send a session established report, including its telephone numbers, to the trackside.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.8.b
Notes: If none of its supported system versions is compatible with the one sent by trackside, it shall send a version independent message indicating “No compatible version supported”. It shall inform the driver and shall terminate the communication session.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.9
Notes: When the trackside receives the session established report or the information that no compatible system version is supported by the on-board, it shall consider the communication session established.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.9.1
Notes: Intentionally
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.10
Notes: If the establishment of a communication session is initiated by the RBC, it shall be performed according to the following steps:
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.10.a
Notes: The trackside shall request the set-up of a safe radio connection with the on-board.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.10.b
Notes: As soon as the safe radio connection is set-up, the trackside shall send the message Initiation of communication session to the on-board.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.10.c
Notes: When the on-board receives the information, it shall consider the communication session established and send a session established report to the trackside.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.10.d
Notes: When the trackside receives the session established report, it shall consider the communication session established.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.11
Notes: In case the RBC is the initiator, the first message from RBC to on-board shall have the time-stamp and the LRBG identity set to unknown.
Author: Cecile
TagValue_Body: In case the RBC is t

Name: REQ-3.5.3.12
Notes: Note: In the case the RBC is the initiator, there is no need to verify the compatibility of the system versions and for the on-board to send its telephone numbers, because the on-board is obviously already known to the RBC.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.13
Notes: An order to contact the RBC may contain a special value for the RBC identity indicating that the on-board shall contact the last known RBC (i.e., using the stored RBC ID/phone number, if any) the phone number indicated in the order shall be ignored by the on-board equipment.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.13.1
Notes: If there is no RBC ID/ phone number stored on-board, the order to contact the RBC shall be ignored.
Author: Cecile
TagValue_Body: If there is no RBC I

Name: REQ-3.5.3.14
Notes: Note: If a short number is used (considering trackside call routing), that number can be programmed into the balise instead of the normal phone number.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.15
Notes: An order to contact the RBC may contain a special value for the RBC phone number indicating that the on-board shall use the on-board short number.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.15.1
Notes: Note: The on-board stored short number for calling the RBC is defined by EIRENE.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.3.16
Notes: Table
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.4
Notes: Maintaining a communication session
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.4.1
Notes: When a communication session is established, in case of a loss of the safe radio connection, i.e., if the disconnection has not been ordered (see 3.5.5.1), the involved entities shall consider the communication session still established for a defined time. The defined time shall start as soon as EURORADIO has indicated the loss of the safe radio connection.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.4.2
Notes: When EURORADIO indicates the loss of the safe radio connection, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall immediately try to set-up a new safe radio connection.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.4.2.1
Notes: If the safe radio connection is not re-established after the defined time (as defined in A3.1), both, on-board equipment and trackside, shall consider the session as terminated.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.4.3
Notes: The attempts shall be repeated, until at least one of the following conditions is met:     The session is considered as terminated.   The safe radio connection is set-up. The train passes the location indicated in the RIU order “Terminate the communication session”
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.4.3.1
Notes: Note: if the session is considered as terminated due to 3.5.4.2.1, the attempts will be resumed immediately according to 3.5.3.4 f).
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.4.4
Notes: Exception to 3.5.4.2 and 3.5.4.3: the on-board equipment shall not try to set up a new safe radio connection and shall stop any on-going attempts if the train front is inside an announced radio hole (see 3.12.1.3). The on-board equipment shall try to set it up again when the train front reaches the end of the radio hole.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.4.5
Notes: In case a message has to be sent during the loss of the safe radio connection, this message shall be considered as sent.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5
Notes: Terminating a communication session
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.1
Notes: The termination of a communication session shall be initiated only by the on-board and in the following cases
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.1.a
Notes: If an order is received from trackside (RBC, RIU or balise groups) (see sections 3.5.3.5 and 3.5.3.6 concerning the content of the order).
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.1.b
Notes: If an error condition requiring the termination of the communication session is detected on-board (e.g., not compatible system versions between on-board and trackside).
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.1.c
Notes: The train is rejected by RBC during Start of Mission.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.1.d
Notes: If the driver closes the desk during Start of Mission.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.1.e
Notes: In case the train has reported having exited from an RBC area and no order to terminate the session is received within a fixed waiting time (see Appendix A.3.1) from the time the position report was sent, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall repeatedly send a position report with the fixed waiting time after each repetition, until the order to terminate the session is received, or the defined number of repetitions (see Appendix A.3.1) has been reached. If no reply is received within the fixed waiting time after the last repetition, the ERTMS/ETCS on-board equipment shall terminate the communication session.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.1.f
Notes: In case of communication session with an RIU: the Level 1 is left, or, an End of Mission is executed.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.2
Notes: In case a session is established, the on-board equipment shall terminate the communication session according to the following steps:
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.2.a
Notes: The on-board equipment shall send a Termination of communication session message.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.2.b
Notes: As soon as this information is received, the trackside shall consider the communication session terminated and send an acknowledgement to the on-board.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.2.c
Notes: When the acknowledgement is received the on-board shall consider the communication session terminated and request the release of the safe radio connection with trackside.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.3
Notes: No further message shall be sent by the on-board after the message Termination of communication session.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.3.1
Notes: Exception: In case a communication session is established and no acknowledgement is received within a fixed waiting time (see Appendix A.3.1) after sending the “Termination of communication session” message, the message shall be repeated with the fixed waiting time after each repetition.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.3.2
Notes: After a defined number of repetitions (see Appendix A.3.1), and if no acknowledgment is received within the fixed waiting time from the time of the last sending of “Termination of communication session”, the ERTMS/ETCS onboard equipment shall consider the communication session terminated.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.4
Notes: No further message shall be sent by the trackside after Acknowledgement of the termination of communication session. the
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.5
Notes: The information Termination of Communication Session Acknowledgement shall be the same in every system version. corresponding
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.6
Notes: Messages from the RBC received onboard after the message “Termination of communication session” has been sent shall be ignored with the exception of the Acknowledgement of the termination of communication session.
Author: Cecile

Name: REQ-3.5.5.7
Notes: In case an order to terminate the communication session is received, while the communication session is currently being established, the on-board shall abort the process of establishing it and shall release the safe radio connection.
Author: Cecile
